title: The 'ENS or chat key' input field does not adjust its size to the scanned data from a QR code

labels.name: E:Mobile Wallet MVP
labels.description: Design system components, initial research and page wireframes

labels.name: E:Mobile Wallet Release 1.27
labels.description: all tasks for 1.27 related to wallet

body:
### Steps:
1.'User A' generates a QR profile code.
2. 'User B' navigates to the 'Add contact' page and scans the contact using the device's camera.
3. 'User B' scans 'User A's QR code by initiating the camera from the bottom part of the QR code.

Steps if the issue is not reproduced after **step 3**
4. If the issue is not reproduced after step 3, 'User B' attempts to scan an invalid QR code. (example: 
![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/52490791/9b8768e7-694d-41a4-b487-1f57a04d2275)
)
5. 'User B' rescans the QR code of 'User A.'

### Actual result:
After scanning, the 'ENS or chat key' input field fails to adjust to the size of the fetched data. Consequently, only the second line of the chat key is visible within the input field.


https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/52490791/6d3914d5-c2d4-40d7-9406-31b9c0aff933


### Expected result:
Upon scanning a QR code, the 'ENS or chat key' input field should dynamically adjust its size to display the entire chat key,

### Device:
Pixel 7a, Android 13


### Logs:
[Status-debug-logs (1).zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/13390689/Status-debug-logs.1.zip)

### Additional info:
- Currently, the issue reproduces randomly, occurring only when quickly initiating the camera hover from the bottom QR's edge

I belive the consequenced issue is related to issue https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/issues/17943#issue-2001005728

## ISSUE 2: The 'ETH' input field does not adjust its size to the scanned data from a QR code

### Steps:
1. Generate an ETH QR code (from Status or Metamask).
2. Go to Add address to watch screen
3. Scan the QR code by starting the camera from the bottom part of the QR.
4. Observe the result.

### Actual result:

After scanning the QR code containing eth address, the 'ETH' input field fails to adjust to the size of the fetched data. Consequently, only the second line of the eth address is visible within the input field.

https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/52490791/03547f91-9e21-4d40-ad35-6cc5764f005e
